caption:
This photograph captures a somewhat bleak and unsettling landscape dominated by a large, older two-story house that appears somewhat dilapidated. The house is painted white but shows signs of wear and neglect. It features a traditional architectural style with a peaked roof, multiple windows, and an elevated front porch with what seems to be a broken railing.

The house is situated on a high, exposed piece of ground, likely a hill or mound, which seems to have been partially excavated or eroded, as indicated by the raw, dug-up earth in the foreground and around the sides. This creates a stark contrast between the natural and disturbed land.

In front of the house, there is a large red cylindrical tank, possibly for fuel or storage, which adds a touch of color to the otherwise muted landscape. The environment around the house includes a few sparse trees with autumnal foliage and a couple of evergreens. The background is a flat horizon line that suggests a rural setting, featuring distant power lines and minimal building structures.

The overall mood of the photo is desolate and gives a sense of isolation, possibly hinting at themes of abandonment or transition. The lighting in the image is soft, with a haze that might suggest it was taken in the early morning or late afternoon, casting long shadows and contributing to the somber tone of the scene.
title: This house off route 250, has had its windows and doors knocked out, legally qualifying it as "derelict."  Now the coal company is stripping around it
